title: Tips for 3rd sem
content: I have completed first year with 6.7 as my CGPA, I want to clutch from 3rd sem. How many hours should an average student study to start maintaining good grades?

comments.body: Pay attention in class and try to do PESU slides at least twice and work hard for ISAs.

WT and DSA are coding-based subjects. You should be thorough with all the codes and implementations as they ask for codes in ISAs and ESAs. 

DDCO, AFLL, and SDS require practice as they are very logical subjects. For SDS, doing classwork problems is a must because many questions were the same in the ISA, at least last year.

Study the day before.
But also listen to class.
